svcsubproc.title: General Guidelines For Removal
svcsubproc.para: The following steps provide a guideline sequence for cab removal. The details of the removal procedure vary for different vehicle models, and for special equipment and accessories.

step1.para: Block vehicle wheels and release parking brake.
Drain air from air system.
On SBA 5000 i series (with fiberglass tilt hood), SFA 5000 i series and 9000 i series, tilt hood forward and remove air cleaner ducts, if required.
On SBA 5000 i series (with butterfly hood, optional after August 1994), remove hood, stay rods and air cleaner ducts. Refer to GROUP 09 - HOOD, GRILLE, AND FENDERS in the Master Service Manual.
Discharge air conditioning system and disconnect system lines, if so equipped. Refer to GROUP 16 - CAB in the Master Service Manual for the proper procedures.

warning.para: To avoid personal injury or death, DO NOT remove components while pressure is in the air conditioning system. Refrigerant must be recovered from the air conditioning system before any components of the system are removed or replaced.
To help protect the environment, always use approved refrigerant recycling equipment when working with R-134a. Federal and state laws require that refrigerant be recovered and recycled.

Effective November 1995, recovery and recycling of R-134a will be required by law. Do not vent refrigerant into the atmosphere. Because of the absence of chlorine in the molecular structure of R-134a, the use of R-134a refrigerant will not have any harmful effects on the ozone layer of the atmosphere. Because there is not enough evidence to determine the "greenhouse" effect of R-134a, recycling of R-134a is recommended.

step1.para: Disconnect battery ground cable and frame-to-cab ground cable.
Remove steering gear universal joint at steering gear.
Disconnect accelerator linkage and cruise-control, if so equipped.
Disconnect wiring harness connectors from cab dash and floor panels.
Disconnect heater hoses, clutch linkage, engine shut off control cable, brake air lines and hoses, and auxiliary oil filter hose.

warning.para: To avoid personal injury, whenever any component is serviced or removed from the air system, be sure the air system is drained and be sure to set the parking brake and/or block the vehicle wheels to prevent the vehicle from moving while the service is being performed.

step1.para: Remove transmission gearshift lever. Refer to GROUP - 13 TRANSMISSION in the Master Service Manual.
Detach any other connections between cab and frame, if required.

svcsubproc.title: Remove SBA and SFA Cab for 5000 i Series with Rear Hard Mount before November 1999
svcsubproc.para: Refer to Figure 94 for Items in parentheses.

step1.para: To remove SBA and SFA cab for 5000 i series with rear hard mount before November 1999, use the following procedure.

step2.para: Remove hex flanged head bolt and hex flanged lock nut (Items 1 and 2, View Circle A) securing front cab mounting bracket (Item 3, View Circle A), located on engine side of cab cowl, to chassis front cab mounting bracket (Item 4, View Circle A), both sides.

From underneath the rear cab mounting crossmember (Item 16), remove hex lock nut (Item 10), flat washer (Item 6), cab mounting insulator (Item 8) and insulator retainer (Item 9) from each hex head bolt (Item 5).

To access the head of the two hex head bolts (Item 5), lift the floor mat behind the seats, unless being replaced, each hex head bolt (Item 5), flat washer (Item 6), spring (Item 7), flat washer (Item 6), cab mounting insulator (Item 8) and insulator retainer (Item 9) used to secure upper rear cab mounting bracket (Item 11) to lower rear cab mounting bracket (Item 12) can remain in place when the cab is lifted from the chassis.

note.para: Use an overhead crane and cab lifting fixture when removing cab from chassis. Pad lifting fixture to prevent damage to cab assembly.

step1.para: Carefully lift cab off chassis. Once the front cab mounting bracket (Item 3, View Circle A) has cleared the chassis front cab mounting bracket (Item 4, View Circle A), remove two mounting bracket bushings and spacer (Items 13 and 14, View Circle A). Also remove two insulators (Item 15) from lower rear cab mounting bracket (Item 12). Save for reinstallation.
Place cab assembly on a padded surface to prevent damage to cab assembly and paint.

figure.caption: Figure 94. SBA and SFA Cab for 5000 i Series with Rear Hard Mount before November 1999

calloutgroup.callout1: 17. HEX FLANGED HEAD BOLT, FLANGED HEX LOCK NUT. TIGHTEN TO 100 TO 120 Lbf-ft (136 TO 163 N•m)
19. HEX HEAD BOLT, LOCK WASHER, FLAT WASHER
20. HEX FLANGED HEAD BOLT AND HEX FLANGED LOCK NUT

svcsubproc.title: Remove SBA and SFA Cab for 5000 i Series with Rear Hard Mount after November 1999
svcsubproc.para: Refer to Figure 95 for Items in parentheses.

step1.para: To remove SBA and SFA cab for 5000 i series with rear hard mount after November 1999, use the following procedure.

step2.para: Remove hex head bolt (Item 1), flat washer (Item 2), front cab mounting safety stop (Item 3) and hex lock nut (Item 4) securing front cab mounting bracket (Item 5), located on engine side of cab cowl, to front cab mounting insulator (Item 16) and chassis front cab mounting bracket (Item 6) mounted to frame rail (Item 22), both sides.
From underneath the rear cab mounting crossmember (Item 19), remove hex lock nut (Item 12), flat washer (Item 8) and rear cab mounting insulator (Item 10) from each hex head bolt (Item 7).

To access the head of the two hex head bolts (Item 7), lift the floor mat behind the seats, unless being replaced, each hex head bolt (Item 7), flat washer (Item 8), spring (Item 9), flat washer (Item 8), cab mounting insulator (Item 10) and insulator retainer (Item 11) used to secure upper rear cab mounting bracket (Item 13) to lower rear cab mounting bracket (Item 14) can remain in place when the cab is lifted from the chassis.

note.para: Use an overhead crane and cab lifting fixture when removing cab from chassis. Pad lifting fixture to prevent damage to cab assembly.

step1.para: Carefully lift cab off chassis. Once the upper rear cab mounting bracket (Item 13) has cleared the lower rear cab mounting bracket (Item 14), remove two insulators (Item 15). Save for reinstallation.
Place cab assembly on a padded surface to prevent damage to cab assembly and paint.

figure.caption: Figure 95. SBA and SFA Cab for 5000 i Series with Rear Hard Mount after November 1999

calloutgroup.callout1: 1. HEX HEAD BOLT, 3/4-10 UNC X 5 1/2. TIGHTEN TO 185 TO 200 Lbf-ft (251 TO 271 N•m)
4. HEX LOCK NUT, 3/4-10 UNC. TIGHTEN TO 185 TO 200 Lbf-ft (251 TO 271 N•m)
18. HEX FLANGED HEAD BOLT, 1/2-20 UNF X 1 1/2
20. HEX FLANGED HEAD BOLT, 1/2-20 UNF X 1 1/2. TIGHTEN TO 100 TO 120 Lbf-ft (136 TO 163 N•m)
21. HEX FLANGED LOCK NUT, 1/2-20 UNF. TIGHTEN TO 100 TO 120 Lbf-ft (136 TO 163 N•m)

svcsubproc.title: Remove Front Cab Mounting Insulator for SBA and SFA 5000 i Series with Rear Hard Mount after November 1999
svcsubproc.para: Refer to Figure 95 for Items in parentheses.

step1.para: Once the cab is lifted from the chassis, if it is necessary to replace the front cab mounting insulator (Item 16), driver side shown. Remove as follows.

Remove two hex flanged lock nuts (Item 17) from two hex flanged head bolts (Item 18) and remove both hex flanged head bolts. Remove front cab mounting insulator (Item 16 from cab chassis mounting bracket (Item 6), driver side shown. Save front cab mounting insulator, hex flanged lock nuts and hex flanged head bolts for installation unless damaged and being replaced.
Repeat procedure to remove passenger side front cab mounting insulator.

svcsubproc.title: Remove SBA Cab for 5000 i Series with Rear Cab Air Suspension System after August 1994 and SFA Cab for 5000 i Series with Rear Cab Air Suspension System after August 1996
svcsubproc.para: Refer to Figure 96 for Items in parentheses.

step1.para: To remove SBA Cab for 5000 i Series with Rear Cab Air Suspension System after August 1994 and SFA Cab for 5000 i Series with Rear Cab Air Suspension System after August 1996, use the following procedure.

step2.para: Remove hex head bolt (Item 1), flat washer (Item 2), front cab mounting safety stop (Item 3) and hex lock nut (Item 4) securing front cab mounting bracket (Item 5), located on engine side of cab cowl, to front cab mounting insulator (Item 14) and chassis front cab mounting bracket (Item 6) mounted to frame rail (Item 17), both sides.

Lift the floor mat behind the seats to access the four hex flanged head bolts, unthread each hex flanged head bolt (Item 7) with spacer (Item 8) and flat washer (Item 9) from weld nuts on right side cab mounting bracket (Item 11) and left side cab mounting bracket (Item 12) of rear cab crossmember support/cab air suspension (Item 13).

Unless being replaced, each hex flanged head bolt (Item 7) with spacer (Item 8) and flat washer (Item 9) used to secure the cab to the rear cab crossmember support/cab air suspension (Item 13) can remain in place when the cab is lifted from the chassis.

note.para: Use an overhead crane and cab lifting fixture when removing cab from chassis. Pad lifting fixture to prevent damage to cab assembly.

step1.para: Carefully lift cab off front cab mounting insulator (Item 14) on chassis front cab mounting bracket (Item 6) and right side cab mounting bracket (Item 11) and left side cab mounting bracket (Item 12) of rear cab crossmember support/cab air suspension (Item 13).
Place cab assembly on a padded surface to prevent damage to cab assembly and paint.

figure.caption: Figure 96. SBA Cab for 5000 i Series with Rear Cab Air Suspension System after August 1994 and SFA Cab for 5000 i Series with Rear Cab Air Suspension System after August 1996

calloutgroup.callout1: 1. HEX HEAD BOLT, 3/4-10 UNC X 5 1/2. TIGHTEN TO 185 TO 200 Lbf-ft (251 TO 271 N•m)
4. HEX LOCK NUT, 3/4-10 UNC. TIGHTEN TO 185 TO 200 Lbf-ft (251 TO 271 N•m)
7. HEX FLANGED HEAD BOLT, 1/2-13 UNC X 71/2
10. CAB AIR SUSPENSION BRACKET MOUNTING PLATE
13. REAR CAB CROSSMEMBER SUPPORT/CAB AIR SUSPENSION
16. HEX FLANGED HEAD BOLT, 1/2-20 UNF X 1 1/2

svcsubproc.title: Remove Front Cab Mounting Insulator for SBA Cab for 5000 i Series with Rear Cab Air Suspension System after August 1994 and SFA Cab for 5000 i Series with Rear Cab Air Suspension System after August 1996
svcsubproc.para: Refer to Figure 96 for Items in parentheses.

step1.para: Once the cab is lifted from the chassis, if it is necessary to replace the front cab mounting insulator (Item 14), driver side shown. Remove as follows.

Remove two hex flanged lock nuts (Item 15) from two hex flanged head bolts (Item 16) and remove both hex flanged head bolts. Remove front cab mounting insulator (Item 14) from cab chassis mounting bracket (Item 6), driver side shown. Save front cab mounting insulator, hex flanged lock nuts and hex flanged head bolts for installation unless damaged and being replaced.
Repeat procedure to remove passenger side front cab mounting insulator.

svcsubproc.title: Remove Day Cab for 9100 i, 9200 i, 9400 i and 9900 i Models with Rear Hard Mount
svcsubproc.para: Refer to Figure 97 for Items in parentheses.

step1.para: To remove day cab for 9100 i, 9200 i, 9400 i and 9900 i models with rear hard mount, use the following procedure.

step2.para: Remove hex head bolt (Item 1), flat washer (Item 2), front cab mounting safety stop (Item 3), flat washer (Item 4) and hex lock nut (Item 5) securing front cab mounting bracket (Item 6), located on engine side of cab cowl, to front cab mounting insulator (Item 18) and chassis front cab mounting bracket (Item 7) mounted to frame rail (Item 27), both sides.

From underneath lower rear cab mounting bracket (Item 16), remove hex flanged lock nut (Item 14), rear rebound insulator (Item 11) and rebound insulator retainer (Item 13) from each hex head bolt (Item 8).

To access the head of the two hex head bolts (Item 8), lift the floor mat behind the seats, unless being replaced, each hex head bolt (Item 8), flat washer (Item 9), spring (Item 10), rear rebound insulator (Item 11) and rebound insulator retainer (Item 12) used to secure upper rear cab mounting bracket (Item 15) to lower rear cab mounting bracket (Item 16) can remain in place when the cab is lifted from the chassis.

note.para: Use an overhead crane and cab lifting fixture when removing cab from chassis. Pad lifting fixture to prevent damage to cab assembly.

step1.para: Carefully lift cab off chassis. Once the upper rear cab mounting bracket (Item 15) has cleared the lower rear cab mounting bracket (Item 16), remove two rear cab mounting insulators (Item 17). Save for reinstallation.
Place cab assembly on a padded surface to prevent damage to cab assembly and paint.

figure.caption: Figure 97. Day Cab for 9100 i, 9200 i, 9400 i and 9900 i Models with Rear Hard Mount

calloutgroup.callout1: 8. HEX HEAD BOLT, 1/2-13 UNC X 7 1/2 (TIGHTEN BOLT UNTIL TOP WASHER IS FLUSH WITH TOP OF SILL)
20. HEX FLANGED HEAD BOLT, 1/2-20 UNF X 1 1/2
21. HEX FLANGED HEAD BOLT, 3/8-16 UNC X 1 1/2 AND LOCK WASHER
22. HEX FLANGED HEAD BOLT, 3/8-16 UNC X 2, FLAT WASHER, LOCK WASHER AND HEX LOCK NUT, 3/8-16 UNC
26. HEX HEAD BOLT, 1/4-20 UNC X 1 AND HEX LOCK NUT, 1/4-20 UNC

svcsubproc.para: Refer to Figure 97 for Items in parentheses.

step1.para: Once the cab is lifted from the chassis, if it is necessary to replace the front cab mounting insulator (Item 18), driver side shown. Remove as follows.

Remove two hex flanged lock nuts (Item 19) from two hex flanged head bolts (Item 20) and remove both hex flanged head bolts. Remove front cab mounting insulator (Item 18) from cab chassis mounting bracket (Item 7), driver side shown. Save front cab mounting insulator, hex flanged lock nuts and hex flanged head bolts for installation unless damaged and being replaced.

step2.para: Remove hex head bolt (Item 1), flat washer (Item 2), front cab mounting safety stop (Item 3), flat washer (Item 4) and hex lock nut (Item 5) securing front cab mounting bracket (Item 6), located on engine side of cab cowl, to front cab mounting insulator (Item 13) and chassis front cab mounting bracket (Item 7) mounted to frame rail (Item 16), both sides.

To access the head of the two hex head bolts (Item 8), lift the floor mat behind the seats, unless being replaced, each hex head bolt (Item 8), spacer (Item 9), flat washer (Item 10) and flat washer (Item 10) used to secure cab floor and rear cab sill bracket (Item 11) to cab air suspension system (Item 12) can remain in place when the cab is lifted from the chassis.

note.para: Use an overhead crane and cab lifting fixture when removing cab from chassis. Pad lifting fixture to prevent damage to cab assembly.

step1.para: Place cab assembly on a padded surface to prevent damage to cab assembly and paint.

svcsubproc.title: Remove 51 Inch or 72 Inch Pro-Sleeper® Cab for 9200 i and 9400 i Models with Rear Cab Air Suspension System
svcsubproc.para: Refer to Figure 102 for Items in parentheses.

step1.para: To remove 51 Inch or 72 Inch pro-sleeper® cab for 9200 i and 9400 i models with rear cab air suspension system, use the following procedure.

step2.para: Remove hex head bolt (Item 1), flat washer (Item 2), front cab mounting safety stop (Item 3), flat washer (Item 4) and hex lock nut (Item 5) securing front cab mounting bracket (Item 6), located on engine side of cab cowl, to front cab mounting insulator (Item 12) and chassis front cab mounting bracket (Item 7) mounted to frame rail (Item 15), both sides.

To access the head of the six hex head bolts (Item 8), lift the floor mat inside the bunk, unless being replaced, each hex head bolt (Item 8) and flat washer (Item 9) used to secure cab floor and rear cab sill bracket (Item 10) to cab air suspension system (Item 11) can remain in place when the cab is lifted from the chassis.

note.para: Use an overhead crane and cab lifting fixture when removing cab from chassis. Pad lifting fixture to prevent damage to cab assembly.

step1.para: Place cab assembly on a padded surface to prevent damage to cab assembly and paint.

calloutgroup.callout1: 14. HEX FLANGED HEAD BOLT, 1/2-20 UNF X 1 1/2
18. HEX FLANGED HEAD BOLT, 5/8-18 UNF X 2

svcsubproc.title: Remove Front Cab Mounting Insulator on 51 Inch or 72 Inch Pro-Sleeper® Cab for 9200 i and 9400 i Models with Rear Cab Air Suspension System
svcsubproc.para: Refer to Figure 102 for Items in parentheses.

step1.para: Once the cab is lifted from the chassis, if it is necessary to replace the front cab mounting insulator (Item 12), driver side shown. Remove as follows.

Remove two hex flanged lock nuts (Item 13) from two hex flanged head bolts (Item 14) and remove both hex flanged head bolts. Remove front cab mounting insulator (Item 12) from chassis front cab mounting bracket (Item 7), driver side shown. Save front cab mounting insulator, hex flanged lock nuts and hex flanged head bolts for installation unless damaged and being replaced.
Repeat procedure to remove passenger side front cab mounting insulator.

svcsubproc.title: Remove 51 Inch Pro-Sleeper® Cab for 9200 i, 9400 i and 9900 i Models with Rear Cab Air Suspension System on Vehicles after April 2000
svcsubproc.para: Refer to Figure 103 for Items in parentheses.

step1.para: To remove 51 inch pro-sleeper® cab for 9200 i, 9400 i and 9900 i models with rear cab air suspension system on vehicles after April 2000, use the following procedure.

note.para: On 9900 vehicles manufactured at Escobedo there will be two flat washers (Item 2) found on each side under hex head bolt (Item 1).

step2.para: Remove hex head bolt (Item 1), flat washer (Item 2), front cab mounting safety stop (Item 3), flat washer (Item 4) and hex lock nut (Item 5) securing front cab mounting bracket (Item 6), located on engine side of cab cowl, to front cab mounting insulator (Item 11) and chassis front cab mounting bracket (Item 7) mounted to frame rail (Item 14), both sides.
To access the head of the six hex head screw sems assemblies (Item 8), lift the floor mat inside the bunk.
Remove six hex head screw sems assemblies (Item 8) securing cab floor and rear cab sill bracket (Item 9) to rear cab air suspension assembly (Item 10).

note.para: Use an overhead crane and cab lifting fixture when removing cab from chassis. Pad lifting fixture to prevent damage to cab assembly.

step1.para: Place cab assembly on a padded surface to prevent damage to cab assembly and paint.

figure.caption: Figure 103. 51 Inch Pro-Sleeper® Cab for 9200 i, 9400 i and 9900 i Models with Rear Cab Air Suspension System on Vehicles after April 2000

calloutgroup.callout1: 8. HEX HEAD SCREW SEMS ASSEMBLY, 3/8-16 X 1 1/4
13. HEX FLANGED HEAD BOLT, 1/2-20 UNF X 1 1/2
17. HEX HEAD SCREW SEMS ASSEMBLY, 3/8-16 X 1 1/4

svcsubproc.title: Remove Front Cab Mounting Insulator on 51 Inch Pro-Sleeper® Cab for 9200 i, 9400 i and 9900 i Models with Rear Cab Air Suspension System on Vehicles after April 2000
svcsubproc.para: Refer to Figure 103 for Items in parentheses.

step1.para: Once the cab is lifted from the chassis, if it is necessary to replace the front cab mounting insulator (Item 11), driver side shown. Remove as follows.

Remove two hex flanged lock nuts (Item 12) from two hex flanged head bolts (Item 13) and remove both hex flanged head bolts. Remove front cab mounting insulator (Item 11) from chassis front cab mounting bracket (Item 7), driver side shown. Save front cab mounting insulator, hex flanged lock nuts and hex flanged head bolts for installation unless damaged and being replaced.
Repeat procedure to remove passenger side front cab mounting insulator.

svcsubproc.title: Remove 72 Inch Pro-Sleeper® Cab for 9200 i, 9400 i and 9900 i Models with Rear Cab Air Suspension System on Vehicles after April 2000
svcsubproc.para: Refer to Figure 104 for Items in parentheses unless otherwise noted.

step1.para: To remove 72 inch pro-sleeper® cab for 9200 i, 9400 i and 9900 i models with rear cab air suspension system on vehicles after April 2000, use the following procedure.

note.para: On 9900 vehicles manufactured at Escobedo there will be two flat washers (Item 2) found on each side under hex head bolt (Item 1).

step2.para: Remove hex head bolt (Item 1), flat washer (Item 2), front cab mounting safety stop (Item 3), flat washer (Item 4) and hex lock nut (Item 5) securing front cab mounting bracket (Item 6), located on engine side of cab cowl, to front cab mounting insulator (Item 11) and chassis front cab mounting bracket (Item 7) mounted to frame rail (Item 14), both sides.
To access the head of the six hex head screw sems assemblies (Item 8), lift the floor mat inside the bunk.
Remove six hex head screw sems assemblies (Item 8) securing cab floor and rear cab sill bracket (Figure 103, Item 9) to rear cab air suspension assembly (Item 10).

note.para: Use an overhead crane and cab lifting fixture when removing cab from chassis. Pad lifting fixture to prevent damage to cab assembly.

step1.para: Place cab assembly on a padded surface to prevent damage to cab assembly and paint.

figure.caption: Figure 104. 72 Inch Pro-Sleeper® Cab for 9200 i, 9400 i and 9900 i Models with Rear Cab Air Suspension System on Vehicles after April 2000

svcsubproc.title: Remove Front Cab Mounting Insulator on 72 Inch Pro-Sleeper® Cab for 9200 i, 9400 i and 9900 i Models with Rear Cab Air Suspension System on Vehicles after April 2000
svcsubproc.para: Refer to Figure 104 for Items in parentheses.

step1.para: Once the cab is lifted from the chassis, if it is necessary to replace the front cab mounting insulator (Item 11), driver side shown. Remove as follows.

Remove two hex flanged lock nuts (Item 12) from two hex flanged head bolts (Item 13) and remove both hex flanged head bolts. Remove front cab mounting insulator (Item 11) from chassis front cab mounting bracket (Item 7), driver side shown. Save front cab mounting insulator, hex flanged lock nuts and hex flanged head bolts for installation unless damaged and being replaced.
Repeat procedure to remove passenger side front cab mounting insulator.
